Blog.post: People are remixing Jay-Z's Black Album with urlLink The Beatles , urlLink Weezer , urlLink Metallica , urlLink Pavement , and just about everybody else. You can urlLink make your own remix , too.
urlLink If you are not the Crackhead that took my sparkplugs, please disregard this posting.
Exciting moments in technical writing... urlLink from AT&T's 1952 technical manual on how to sweep the floor .

There is an interesting urlLink conspiracy theory here that I read about urlLink here . It suggests that Bill Waterson, author of Calvin and Hobbes, is now writing a strip called urlLink Frazz . After a little reading around the net, don't think I believe it, but Frazz is worth checking out. urlLink Here is an interesting article about Bill Waterson from 2003.
urlLink This is a short and hilarious story about a toy blimp.

urlLink A cross between R2D2 and a vending machine , Koolio receives commands over a wireless network to bring refreshing drinks to busy computer scientists. Now we see the lengths to which fat, sedentary geeks will go to avoid a little physical exertion. (Just kidding, Koolio is awesome :)
urlLink Still frames from the Alfred Hitchcock Movie Vertigo (1958) compared to the same locations today. Vertigo was shot in San Francisco. I like urlLink this one .
Haven't looked at all of these yet, but my favorites so far are urlLink "Sarcastic Respect for Authority Figures," urlLink "Faked Surprise," and urlLink Motherly Love .
Three kids in Mississippi spent seven years making a urlLink shot for shot remake of Raiders of the Lost Ark . Man, I would love to see this...
urlLink This late 50's album by the man who was the singing voice of Mr. Ed is pretty hilarious. My favs are "Girl In The 4th Dimension," "Crawl Out Through The Fallout," and "Schizophrenic Baby."

urlLink Here you can send a guy your idea for a song, and he will write and record it (if he likes the idea). You can be as specific ("I want a song about the infinite number of monkeys using infinite typewriters. You need to reference at least 5 shakespeare plays and use the word honorificabilitudinitatibus. Make it over 250bpm and in Bb minor.") or as general ("Could you write me one? Entitled... The Zesty Redhead?") as you like. I was a little skeptical at first, but he's really pretty awesome.
A journalist urlLink finds out how easy it is to get a table at a classy restaurant. Reminds me of the Seinfeld Chinese Restaurant episode.

Get your ripped jeans out of the back of the closet (or, heck, just rip up another pair), 'cause GNR is back! Well, kind of. It's not the same guys. It's... urlLink little kids . But they have the same logo! Except for the bubbles coming out of the guns... Anyway, check out the urlLink audition video . They are, apparently, playing at urlLink grocery stores .

In a bid for worst job ever, urlLink here is a man whose entire workday is spent in a chicken suit, taking commands from internet users. Go ahead, wait until he's not doing something and then give him a command (you just type in the box below the video). I tried "spin around" (which he did), then when I said "thank you" he took a bow. Later I let him "have a seat." I have not tested the limits of his obedience... yet.
urlLink Some people in Korea are making 6-figure incomes playing StarCraft.

urlLink Amazon.com wants you to "Search Inside" a little girl's skirt.
urlLink This will put you into a trance.
urlLink German Couple Finds Out Stork Isn't Real
urlLink A French man. His seething distaste for verbs. An entire book without them.
urlLink Compare the price per gallon of various liquids. Scorpion venom, for instance, is almost $39 million/gal.
urlLink This is super fun! You can see my first work of art urlLink here .

urlLink The pizza_party program provides a text only command line interface for ordering DOMINOS pizza from the terminal. Because fat lazy computer geeks would rather spend days writing a program to order a pizza for them than actually pick up a phone and talk to a human being. (Thanks to Colin for the link)

1. A guy named urlLink Crazy Legs Conti donned a diving mask and snorkel on Tuesday inside the lobby of the Manhattan movie theater and vowed to eat his way through the 50 cubic feet of salted, buttered popcorn in about eight hours, in time for the premiere of a movie about himself. 2. urlLink "Is there a Mrs. Snake Man?" "Yes. Yes, there is." 3. urlLink Canadian lawmakers argue over how to pronounce the name of Gina Lollobrigida , an "aging Italian sex kitten" (whatever that means). Many quotable lines, such as: "It's Gina Lollobrigida, idiot!" Kenney says he was sorry for "offending the aging sex kitten community." Speaking afterward, Volpe made an apology of his own. "I'm sorry I called him an idiot. I should have referred to him as an imbecile." 4. urlLink The History of International Tuba Day . Second paragraph down: Think for a minute: What does the tuba mean to you? Not surprisingly, I found all these wacky things on urlLink Dave Barry's weblog .
urlLink The Shining , in 30 seconds, reinacted by bunnies.
urlLink Bad Scrabble hands.
urlLink The amount Google chose to raise in their IPO is the mathematical constant "e" times 1 billion. So nerdy!
urlLink If you don't go to this website, that means the terrorists have already won!
urlLink And from then on, he was known to all as Harpoon Face. Check out that X-Ray!

A friend at work gave me a T-1000 toy. So I made a cardboard guitar for it, and another friend made a paper hat out of a Post-It Note. Here he is, rocking out: Picture taken with my cell phone, hence the crappiness.

I'm about to check out Fading Dawn - looking forward to it. So I was just watchin Comedy Central and I saw an ad for Girls Gone Wild, which had the "alluring" statement that you can now see college girls - doing things they *never* taught you in school. That cracks me up. Apparently, when I watch the girls flashing the camera, I will be reminded that I didn't learn about this "flashing" with the "breasts" in any of my classes at A&M. I'm quite disgusted by this, since I did complete Introduction to Nippology, and did quite well in Drunken Girls Pretending To Like Me 101. I guess I'd better order the video, or sue A&M, or both. On a separate note, Germans love David Hasselhoff. And I'm in my underwear. Good night. Big Johnny

...having waited well into week 2 of what is quickly become a Song Month . Something with a great beat and a 12-layer guitar solo, maybe? No, this is a one-take recording of a very mellow and serious song I wrote today called urlLink Fading Dawn (title given to me by Johnathan). Maybe tomorrow will be the day for the 12-layer guitar solo, but don't hold your breath :-) Oh yeah, I'm a little unintelligible, so urlLink lyrics are here .

...since I lost all my belongings at poker tonight. Alas, at least I still have Internet access. You gotta have priorities. I'm WAY behind on song week, or so I thought, until I heard that "Song Week" was actually renamed "Song Ambiguous-Period-of-Time-That's-Not-Necessarily-Limited-To-A-Week". So apparently I'm still okay. Derek - I love Parts Underlined - the guitar part and effects fit your voice really well! Off to dreamland... Johan
Here's my song for Friday. I experimented a little with some effects (mostly on the guitar part); haven't decided yet if I like them. urlLink Parts Underlined.
...this is an old folk standard I've been wanting to redo for a while. I tried to give it a kind of Bob Dylan-style vocal. It's called urlLink The Ballad of the T-1000 .

I was a full day behind today, since I didn't have time to finish yesterday's song before passing out on the bed. However, a new day has emerged, and I have caught up with two *ahem* interesting tunes. The first, urlLink NBGTA , was titled by Derek, and is not so much a "song" but rather a totally improvised guitar part while reading some scribbled notes about JJ, the NB (you'll see). Listen for what I say at the very end - I think you'll agree! The second song, urlLink Catch Me If You Can (also titled by Derek), was the first attempt at recording my piano...and the verdict is...I need a good sound card and a preamp/mixer to control the magnitude of the signal it puts out. So I apologize for the crazy hum - also, I had to record the voice on top of that, and it was hard to hear over the humming. It was a fun experiment and I love the song - maybe you can hear it live someday, or maybe just after I get a new setup over here! I'm off to listen to some brand new, hot-off-the-press music about dingleberries! Noofer than Whassuuuuup, Johnny

Johnathan requested that I write a song called Dingleberry Soup. Using the weakest definition of "song" since the Ninja Intervention fiasco of '04, urlLink I put this together. Thanks to Barry for helping out with some of the, um, vocals...
Yes, but I'm too busy drooling over urlLink this video of a guy playing the guitar (thanks, Matt, for the link). He's got, like, eight fingers on each hand. Geez, I'm a hack!

This is longer than Monday's song, yet somehow has fewer references to ninjas, thus defying Yulenhoager's Law of Song-Length-to-Ninja-Reference-Ratios. Eat that, Yulenhoager! Today's song is called urlLink Kaleidoscope , a song title Johnathan gave me and told me to use this week. Actually, I guess we haven't explained that we each made up 3 song titles for each other to use sometime during this Song Week, so you'll be seeing those...(or not, if you decide we suck and never come back to this site.) N.B.G.T.A., Derek

Well, I'm already behind - but I promise, I DID in fact write this song, urlLink Outward, In , yesterday...I just didn't record it since I fell asleep. For punishment, I did this in one take - and the result is less than perfect, especially with so many missed notes! I do really like the words though! I think it's a keeper. So My first song is VERY different from Derek's first...but then again, that song isn't really like anything on the planet. I know he keeps denying it, but I think we all know that Derek HAS TO BE on the pipe. For tonight, I am writing a song that Derek titled for me, although he doesn't know the content yet - not by a long shot - prepare yourself for "N.B.G.T.A.", available probably in the wee hours of the night. Fo' Shizzle, Johnny
My first song for Song Week, Ninja Intervention , is done. urlLink Click here to download it.

Hello dear readers, all three of you, and how are you today? I'm fine, thank you. After an inexcusably long hiatus (not "Hi Anus", Derek...jeez) from monkeybarcongressman.net (a.k.a. MBC), I have decided to get back into the swing of things and do...things. Nothing more than that for now - Derek and I have a great project lined up for this week - see above for details. Peace, love, and nips, Johnny
